The steps are identified by the order in which the ingredients are prepared and presented, as well as by the actions described, such as cutting and arranging the ingredients.
dish_description: The dish is a simple lunch arrangement featuring large sardines in tomato sauce, accompanied by lettuce, sweet onion, tomato, red wine vinegar, olive oil, fresh herbs, and cracked black pepper, served with a piece of bread.

cooking_steps.description: Place the canned sardines in tomato sauce onto a nice tray.
Arrange a little bit of lettuce around the sardines on the tray.
Distribute some thinly sliced sweet onion, such as Vidalia onion, over the sardines.
If available, cut a tomato into wedges and place them around the sardines on the tray.
Drizzle a good dash of red wine vinegar over the sardines and vegetables.
Skip adding olive oil if the sardines already have enough sauce.
Garnish with fresh herbs from the garden, such as parsley.
Finish by cracking some black pepper over the top of the dish.
